### Experience 
</br>
<p style="text-align:left;">
<img src = "images/cityofasylum.png" width = 200px align = "left" hspace=10px vspace = 10px>
<b>City of Asylum, Pittsburgh, PA</b></br>Volunteer, Bookseller, Administrative Assistant, Data Analyst </br>August 2016 – June 2021</br></p>
<p style="clear: left; text-align:left;">
I started as a volunteer in 2016 and helped with program logistics. I was later employed as a bookseller in 2017 and helped create social media posts to highlight translated literature and our writers-in-residence. In 2019 after I graduated, I was hired full-time as an administrative assistant and promoted to a data analyst position in 2020. I helped shift our usual in-person events to an online platform, and helped analyze audience metrics to apply to grants and showcase our impact to sponsors when funding was cut. </br></br>
City of Asylum, Pittsburgh is the largest sanctuary for exiled writers and artists in the world. City of Asylum's mission is to protect and house exiled writers while also protecting and celebrating freedom of expression by hosting free, multicultural, cross-disciplinary programs at Alphabet City, Pittsburgh.
</p>
</br></br>
<p style="text-align:left;">
<img src = "images/dhiranalogo.png" width = 200px" align ="left" hspace=10px vspace = 10px>
<b>Dhirana, Pittsburgh, PA</b> </br> Social Media and Design Committee, Sponsorship Committee, Executive Board </br>August 2015 – May 2019 </br></p>

<p style="clear: left; text-align:left;"> In 2016 and 2017, I helped design the logo, merchandise, and social media for our organization to be distributed and marketed. In 2018, I helped raise $50,001 to donate to the Birmingham Free Clinic in Pittsburgh. BFC's mission is to provide healthcare to the uninsured in Pittsburgh. In 2019, I connected Dhirana with national and international companies and got sponsors to fund our mission. </br></br> Dhirana is a student-run non-profit organization whose mission is to 1) bring awareness and appreciation to Indian Classical Dance, 2) provide a platform for collegiate Indian Classical dancers to perform and compete at the national level, 3) give back to the community by donating all ticket sales to Birmingham Free Clinic. 
</p>

#### Motion Capture for a Short Film
<p style="text-align:left;">
I joined Ripieno Studios at the Carnegie Mellon Entertainment Technology Center to make this short film. I represented Bharatanatyam, an Indian Classical Dance form that originated over 2000 years ago by choreographing a segment and getting motion captured. </p></br>

#### Dance 
<p style="text-align:left;">
Four years old until now - that's how long I've been dancing. Classically trained in bharatanatyam - a 2000+ year old Indian dance form, I performed on stages all over the country. In college, I was co-captain of Pitt's very own Indian Classical Dance team: Nrityamala. We won first place at a competition at George Mason University in 2017,  and audience's choice at Penn State.</p>
